Reviews.Title: “Evening in London”
Reviews.Author: sophie b
Reviews.Content: We spent one evening at this hotel. The staff wasn't welcoming. Good luck to find your room it is a real labyrinthe. It is not clean in the room and in the share space. The decoration is not great and the power of the shower was not great as well. It was quite close to victoria station, 10 minutes. That is the only great point... I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Victoria Station”
Reviews.Author: MacPow
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to Victoria Station, reasonably priced for London, catered to a family and had small bars and restaurants around it. This was a distinct advantage as most of the bars in the center of the city close very early and do not allow teenagers in after a certain time so to find a bar that stayed open till late was a huge plus for this side of London. The hotel staff were very friendly and efficient, the room was very small but warm and cosy. We had a distant view of Big Ben and the London Eye, which was a bonus.The decor was modern but the carpets in the hallways badly need to be replaced. The continental breakfast was just enough to start your day of sightseeing. I would return to this hotel again because of its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Anne W
Reviews.Content: Good points: - The staff were very friendly and helpful. I accidentally left my phone charger in my room and so I rang them up to see if I could get it back. They were diligent in looking for it and phoned me back numerous times to update me. They kept it behind reception for me and I was able to go and pick it up when I was next in the area (they also offered to post it to me). - The rooms were well-appointed with decent-sized beds, flat screen TVs, writing desk, wardrobe, safe and onsuite bathrooms. - It's very good value for money. Bad points: - My room was very cold at night and I couldn't switch the radiator on. - The shower didn't drain properly so it flooded the bathroom floor. - The breakfast is continental only. Overall, I would recommend staying here as it is a great price and location and the staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Victoria”
Reviews.Author: deanfp
Reviews.Content: I have had many good and bad experiences in the old Hotels in Victoria. This hotel is a change from the norm. Clean, spotless, and a delight to stay in. In a road where you take your pick this really is the ace in the pack.

Reviews.Title: “Not too great”
Reviews.Author: Daniel029
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist and very much price and location driven then this might be a good choice. The rooms are not too great. Old carpet, small bedrooms etc. First I saw a room in the basement but it was really a dark basement room so I chose to have the room upstairs. Although there were two double beds it was too small and I could hardly walk around the bed, especially because there was a low roof. The staff was friendly though and tried to help where possible. It seems it is more like a hostel. There is for example no fridge in the room but drinks can be bought at reception. Your suitcases can be stored on your day of arrival/leaving but you get the key and bring them yourself downstairs and everybody else can then get to them. Normally in a decent hotel not a problem but when you are in a budget hotel with tourists I doubt it is safe. Also the room is mouldy so be careful where you put your suitcase and I think the cleaners have access to the room all day. I had some issues with the hot water, probably because I was on the top floor. Once again, if you want a good location this area is great, walking distance to Buckingham palace and victoria station from where you can reach anything by bus and tube.

Reviews.Title: “very good, we are very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: annapaola d
Reviews.Content: Hi, we are two 21 years old italian friends, that went to London for few days after Christmas to visit the city.This is a very nice hotel and it has fully satisfied our needs. It's very close to the Victoria tube and rail station, so, very close to the main items of London... The service was very good; the room and the bathroom were quite small, but very clean, warm and comfortable. The time we spent in our room was very little,so it doesn't matter if it was small beacuse we were there just for sleeping and having breakfast...we were always around the city!! The staff was kind, helpful and friendly. The last day we needed to leave our baggage there for few hours, and was available a free luggage room. The breakfast room was very nice and the food was a lot! We advice you this hotel if you are looking for something nice and in central London. Bye Bye

Reviews.Title: “Was ok!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Peanut
Reviews.Content: Stayed this week, just for the one night whilst me and a friend went to see a show in Victoria. Room was spacious enough, and had facilities that you'd hope to get in a hotel. Couple of points to make, there wasnt a place to put anything in the "bathroom". The bathroom itself was tiny, and I think it would benefit from a seperate shower cubicle rather than a wetroom type of bathroom where the shower curtain sticks to you, but as I said, fine for the one night. There was also a problem with the radiator, it needed bleeding extremely deperately, and at about 2.30am sounded like it was about to explode! I had to turn it off, I did mention it to the man on reception and he said he was going to get it sorted! It wouldn't affect me staying here again, good location, friendly staff, and clean. NB: I just put average for the sleep quality due to the radiator, the beds were lovely and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient”
Reviews.Author: Juliet v
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and sufficient. I stayed here because I had to take an early bus from Victoria Coach station one morning. The rooms are small and the hotel feels like a maze, but I was helped by the friendly staff who walked me all the way up to the room. The bathroom and bed were clean and the room was surprisingly quiet for the location. I didn't use breakfast as I left very early. I used WiFi which was a bit expensive but worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Cave-like, noisy, claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: guest_956
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip, which required me to spend a lot of time in the room working. My room was initially difficult to find due to the maze of corridors- on arrival I was simply told the room was "downstairs". Once located, I found out being on the basement level meant a window that looked onto a corridor and no natural light. It was like being in a cave. A small one. The room had been very well photographed!! A double room only had enough space for one person plus luggage really and what I thought to be a cupboard turned out to be the en suite. It was fully equipped I will say that, although very tightly packed. The shower curtain was not effective and everything in the room ended up drenched after using the shower. The room was clean enough. There was a desk fan in the room which was needed due to the lack of fresh air. I had all the towels I could wish for due to the pleasant house keeping lady coming around each morning about 10am. I can only assume that there were rooms used by the staff on this level as there were people coming and going at all hours. One night there was shouting, heels click-clacking up and down the corridor and doors slamming at 11.45pm. I did not sleep well. I did not work well either as this happened throughout the day also. For the location, it was a practical solution to my needs. The price was good. The food was average. The noise and location of the room were unbearable. Thank goodness the stay was a necessity and not a leisurely treat as I would have been seriously disappointed. Relaxing it was not!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: innoluap
Reviews.Content: I had a very unpleasant stay at this hotel. I was given a room that was totally unacceptable. It was an underground cellar, and was right next to the very noisy lift machinery. The lift was not working well and the noise was even worse, as it kept making a terrible and unbearable noise. The moisture of the underground room made the smell also very unpleasant. I could not sleep for a single minute that night. I paid 92 Pounds for such a terrible stay. The photos of the rooms in the webpage do not correspond at all to what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Louisa1974
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before we stayed and I wasn't expecting too much. I thought the hotel was average. Went to London weekend of the 1/2 Oct when we had the 'heatwave'. Have to say I was so happy that my room had air conditioning as I wouldn't have coped otherwise, room was very hot when we first arrived, but cooled down soon after when we got the air conditioning started. It is in a very convenient location which is a plus point. The bathroom and the breakfast was a bit of a negative. Bathroom is tiny. No space to move about whatsoever. Breakfast is simple, you get cereal, croissants and eggs, that's about it. I knew it was continental in advance but did think you would get more of a variety with the bread and pastries. We did only stay the night, so if you are out visiting london and hardly in your room, it's not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Gary”
Reviews.Author: Gary F
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews before staying at this hotel I phoned in advance and requested a quiet and airy room. This is what I got. The room had been fairly recently renovated and felt fresh and clean. The shower was also good. There is probably a need for the hall and landing carpets to be replaced but the management have already stated that this will be a priority moving forward. There was no problem whatsoever with the room. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The dining area was again newly renovated and very clean. A good continental breakfast was provided. The location was brilliant. Overall I had a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “room review”
Reviews.Author: ron k
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through travelocity and was very disappointed with the stay. The room was nothing like the site pictures. It was so small that you couldn't walk without your spouse having to climb on the bed. There was nowhere to put suitcases and the only way to get into the bed was by climbing up the foot of the bed. I spoke to the day person and was told that the next morning we would be moved to a bigger room but the different person that was there the next morning only gave us the same size room one floor higher in the hotel. Cannot and will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Foodiegyal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for two adults for a nights rest. It is within walking distances to victoria and pimlico train station. The single bed was very comfortable and room had all the basic amenities such a hairdryer, tea and coffee and milk and tv and i was really impressed with the power shower. they gave us towels and shampoo/bodywash. the room was cosy and clean. this was perfect for two student/friends to stay in for the night. we had an exam the following day at the horticulture centre, and it was very close by so perfect location. The breakfast was simple continental with croissants/buns/ tea/coffee/apple juice/cereal/toast etc and boiled eggs too. the staff were friendly a twin room booked approximately a week before our stay cost Â£122

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: FromNYinDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but not too bad. The location is good and the price is especially good for the area. The staff is nice and housekeeping is pretty good. My only complaint is that there is a little bit of a musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “Room in basement without access to fresh air and day light”
Reviews.Author: DerinDeniz
Reviews.Content: When making the reservation I asked for a quite room. The room was very quite indeed, as it was located in the basement. It had a large window, however facing to a corridor of the hotel. This corridor is used for access to other rooms, it had 2 roof hatches. There was no access to fresh air and day light at all. I checked possibilities to get fresh air to the corridor, however also this was impossible, being 3-4 metres below ground. The only device to change the air was a ventilator in the room's lavatory, sucking the air out. The room was clean, but had an odour, which I smelled again when opening my suitcase at home. Allthough a double room (without extra charge) the size of the room and the WC was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and basic, but very good”
Reviews.Author: Lee W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very old, but rooms are clean and the location is perfect. Ten minute walk to buckingham palace, five minute walk to Victoria train station. Lots of restaurantsmand pubs in the nearby streets. Note, front rooms get a bit of traffic noise, so ask for back room if possible. Otherwise you need to keep your windows closed. Free breakfast is basic but all you need to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jsygurl
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in Travel Lodges a bit outside London when I visit on my own, but I wanted something a bit nicer and further in this time as my kids were with me. The photos of the hotel looked lovely, but the rooms we had were not like the photos. We were in two twin rooms, and they were tiny - it was hard passing one bed to reach the other. My bed was right against the window, which had an unexpected advantage, as it was baking hot in London, so I ended up with my feet hanging out the window catching a slight breeze! Luckily we were just staying one night as there is barely any storage room. There is a small amount of open hanging space, and a tiny open bedside thing between the beds, and a very small counter top with a chair underneath, which had the kettle, cups and coffee stuff on it, but that is all. Nowhere for even our small hand luggage to go, the base of the hanging space being taken up by the safe. The bathroom is in a cupboard that you have to step up into and I reckon it, and possibly all the furniture in the room, was bought from a caravan supplier. It was all very reminiscent of a caravan we stayed in in France, though the shower was unexpectedly pleasant, with a good spray. However, my clothes were in the sink, there was nowhere to put them, as it was pretty obvious that the floor was going to get wet, which it did. There is no space for toiletries apart from on the small cistern. A big tub of Dove handwash is fixed above the sink, and another of bodywash in the shower. The beds and furniture were clean, but the bathroom was scruffy - more from age and repair than actuall dirt though. The windows were filthy, they are those many paned sash windows, and are in need of a paint. The duvet was very thin, and though it was baking, I would be concerned about visiting on a chilly night. Continental breakfast was included in the price, and seemed to be a self service bar with those mini cartons of cerial, bread next to a toaster, a machine dispensing juice, and another of milk, a bowl of chopped or tinned fruit, mini muffins, croissant, hard boiled eggs and a hot drinks machine. None of it was any use to me except the juice, black coffee (yuk) and possibly eating jam on toast without butter (yuk) as I am lactose intollerant. The receptionist in the very modern and air conditioned reception was a darling. He pointed me out the newsagent accross the road for supplies, and told me not to order a taxi as there is a minimum charge, and loads drive past all the time (this is true, traffic is constantly passing except int he wee hours, and loads of empty taxis returning to Victoria head past the hotel). The hotel is a quick walk to the Appollo Theatre, which was great as we went to see Wicked, and Victoria station is only a tiny bit further along. This hotel is described as a budget hotel - but it seemed expensive to me - though perhaps I am just not that familiar with the costs of hotels in the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler2701
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights last June. The room was nothing similar to the pictures in their webpage, very outdated. Both, the room and the bathroom were tiny, very hard to walk around. Breakfast & Safe are not included, extra 5 pounds/day each. Staff, very friendly and helpful. Definitely not worth the $190/night! Plus: The hotel is very close to Pimilco & Victoria stations.

Reviews.Title: “Improved, but a bit from 2 years back”
Reviews.Author: singaporeeagles
Reviews.Content: Last time , 2 years ago, was utterly unacceptable as I described as a "torture chamber and jail cell" but now I can describe it as "very austere" but enough to scrape by. Breakfast can be improved as they constantly run out and yoghurt flavour is a joke- only plain flavour? Free WiFI is a real value for money. Location is good as its near Victoria Station. Between my 2 years gap of staying in this hotel there are many other budget hotel so always check their rates as Central House can be more expensive as Central HOuse rooms are just to austere. I stayed in a Premier INN nearby and aside from it charging for wifi , :(, and breakfast it was much better - room quality. Remember, never get the basement room . bathroom in the hotel is a joke too as its small in the corner , Premier Inn pretyy much has the best hotel bathrooms in the budget hotel category. I must say the attitude of the staff has improved greatly in my 2 years gap. Good : Loaction and price, at times when compared to its compeitors . Bad : Breakfast and room furniture but it's a buget hotel not a 5 STar Hotel . Room size , and Bathroom size

Reviews.Title: “Simple & Small but does the job”
Reviews.Author: Lauryn4u2nv
Reviews.Content: My one friend and I stayed at this hotel for two nights (during the royal wedding) We checked in a tad earlier than 2pm and was shown to our room... We had twin beds as we're both girls. The room itself was tiny. It shocked me at first & the bathroom is even smaller. The one single bed was pushed against the window and the other one was more centered in the room with a small dressing table (with a hair dryer) and twa making facilities. If you need an iron they charge you Â£10 for it!! The bathroom is tiny. 2 people can fit in it but could not move limbs!! The shower kinda blends in with the floor and the basin is tiny too, so tiny that I had to tilt my head to brush my teeth & I made a mess over the taps with tOothpaste. They supply towels and there are a lot of plug sockets. The flat screen TV was screwed to the wall a little too high. Oh and the windows don't open - they are padlocked. We could hear traffic going by especially buses. It doesn't bother me too much. I'm not that fussy. Breakfast is a small buffet consisting of cereal, croissants, toast, yoghurts, hard boiled eggs, muffins and fruit. It is basic but nothing to complain about (although they had no special k cereal) Location wise is not too bad I'd say roughly (depending on speed) no more than a 10min walk to Victoria station -turn right @ Gillingham Street and then left past Premier Inn and the side entrance is just across the two crossings - there are a few restaurants in walkin distance too as well as a pub and 2 corner shops.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for short stay only”
Reviews.Author: sax10Brisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March. Convenient if you need to use Victoria Station. Very small room. Breakfast is plentiful. Need to pay for using safe in room and the internet. We had maintenance in our room while away and came back to fine tv off the wall and on the table and wall had been plastered. The building tired and old. You get what you pay for. There are many other hotels in Belgrave Road.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best...”
Reviews.Author: sunsetbabe
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for 2 nights as my husband was running the London marathon I wanted a Central but quiet area googled and found this hotel. Location wise its Brill near Victoria tube station anywhere in London within 15 mins. So what about the hotel well its clean and the reception staff are polite and helpful in general. So we dumped our bags in the luggage room as we couldn't check in til 2pm headed off to the marathon expo. We made our way back to check in and told we where in room 1, I thought ooh this might be good. I was wrong. It was in the basement, so I opened the curtains hoping there was maybe some kind if natural light. I opened the curtains and it was a view of... The hallway??? Waste of a window no natural light made it difficult to sleep as it was a light in the hall all night. The room was small but ok. The bathroom was tiny and every time you put the light on the extractor fan wailed turn the light off and you would have thought the fan would go off? No you had to turn every light in the room off! On the Monday the hotel had no hot water so after my poor hubby had ran a marathon he had to take a freezing cold shower. I washed my hair in the cold it was painful and horrible but no alternative. Reception couldn't tell us when it would be back on and we had to check out. One other note we where near the breakfast room to noise starts at 6am everyday we didn't sleep well in this hotel so because of this and the above we won't be back which is a shame as this hotel has some potential!

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel for an overnight stay that won't cost the earth!”
Reviews.Author: thomsok
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 22 March 2012 when attending a conference. Handy for Victoria train station and Westminster. Reception area was small with only a couple of seats, a TV and a vending machine. Lift was very small up to bedroom and had trouble with key card to get in room. Room was reasonable size with double and single bed, it was clean but in need of some attention. Toilet/shower was tiny. Small portable TV mounted on wall with limited choice of stations. Mobile phone coverage was not good and had to go outside. Breakast was continental and in basement room. Overall it was fine for the one night stay, did not spend much time there other than to sleep and the bed/sheets were ver clean. Would use again if needing a room for the night and not wanting to break bank.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Tory88
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel very last minute on the day, which we got for a very cheap price from their own website. It is literally round the corner from the tube station and very easy to find. We were instantly checked in with ease and had a reasonable sized room with a big bathroom which were both very clean. We nipped out to get some food and discovered a traditional Italian next door, which was rather pleasing! When we returned to our room we were again greeted quickly. I thought the bed was very comfortable and had a good sleep. The continental breakfast was fresh and very tasty. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the cheaper range?”
Reviews.Author: WayneKer
Reviews.Content: The cons: The reception and staff are helpful but very informal. Carpets were badly stained and dirty. Traffic noise from street outside and neighbouring rooms, disturbed sleep. Ear plugs recommended. Old building, noisy floor boards, old TV etc. Residential area with few services. 10 minute walk from Victoria Station No hot water in Shower, called reception twice for assistance and was finally offered access to spare room with shower. The pros: Reviews show this as one of the best of the cheaper hotels in Victoria WI-FI coverage was good and price/time ratio reasonable. Breakfast and dining area was clean and adequate. I would not stay here again (even with a discount).

Reviews.Title: “When i think of it i have to laugh”
Reviews.Author: Haraldsenb
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed one night at this hotel. We wanted to stay near the Victoria station grabbing a train the next morning. Easy to find in the "hotel" avenue in Belgrave road within walking distance to Victoria station. Friendly staff and the room was clean and comfy. The bathroom is one of the smallest i`ve seen but no problem taking a shower etc. The funny part here is (as the title say) the location of the room we stayed in. The gentleman in the reception tried his best to explain how to get there. But after saying thank you, we entered the maze of hallways, stairs, doors and more stairs... going up and down, down and up. Absolutely amazing how we found it! If you get a couple to many in the bar just forget it.. Anyway no worries at this hotel, and location is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanteHarker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in December, location was excellent and considering how cheap the room was very good value for money. Our room was in the basement and a little too close to the noisy breakfast room. Plus, the room's wetroom was a little short on space and pooled water. However, considering the price this wasn't much of a hardship. We paid Â£45 per night for a double room. Great hotel if you are going to the theatre as it is very walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Good decent place to spend your vacation”
Reviews.Author: shahzadyusuf
Reviews.Content: I went on a holiday with my wife & stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel was clean & quality of room was good. Toilets were large enough & cleaned & beds were very comfortable. Would recxommend another stay.

Reviews.Title: “A complete and utter dump”
Reviews.Author: Tom212_10
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we couldn't check in when we first arrived so our bags had to be put in the luggage room which seemed extremely insecure given that anyone staying in the hotel could get the key to enter the luggage room. Corridors and lift smelled awful. Had to book at short notice due to unforeseen circumstances and meant the price was a complete rip off. In our room, there was paint peeling off the walls, exposed electrical wires taped up and there was hardly room to move. The bathroom was another disaster, it was tiny and there was very poor drainage from the shower which very often led to near flooding in the bathroom. Cleaners also called to the rooms very early in the morning and the thin walls meant we could hear the lift going up and down. It was very difficult to close the window fully in the room and it was prevented from opening through the use of a chain. Given that this was in the middle of a heatwave, it led to a very warm and clammy room. Also there is a charge for the use of the safe in the room which again is taking advantage of everyone who stays in the hotel. The breakfast room was in the basement and the awful smell reared its ugly head again every morning when we travelled down to get our breakfast. The room itself was tiny and uncomfortable with tables cramped closely together. Breakfast was very basic and only was available to 9.30am. Essentials like milk were often used up and not refilled and the croissants and eggs were in scarce supply. After 9am, it is near impossible to find a place to sit to have breakfast. Staff seemed ok but the price of the stay per person for the four nights was exorbitant. Only plus is it is close (10 minutes walk) to Victoria station. Avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “it was ok for the night”
Reviews.Author: harmeash
Reviews.Content: this hotel was easy to get to from the Pilmico station, 5minute. it was clean and the staff were helpful, just abit slow though. the room was ok, it did the job.( i was staying here to be able to get to the Oval reasonably quickly for a 8am start) The bed was not very comfortable and the bathroom was a box, way too small for my liking. the walls are thin, can here noise from the street and as my room was outside the lift, could hear thatgoing up and down! i think it was abit expensive for what you get. the breakfast was ok, cold cereals, and croissants etc. i personally wouldn't stay there again, but because it was clean i would recommend it too others with resevation!

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER go back!”
Reviews.Author: ladyannie1986
Reviews.Content: This hotel was.... extremely sub-standard. First of all before arrival we were not informed that we could not check in before 2pm which was extremely inconvienient as we had traveled a long way and were in need of a shower before we went about our buisness in london. when we asked at reception if there was somewhere that we could at least change our clothes and put our bags we were told to go to the toilets to change and put our bags in the "luggage room" which we were given a key to, that was very obviously handed to everyone that stepped through the door and when we found it in the basement it was piled to the ceiling with other peoples bags,damp and extremely insecure. we were given complicated instructions on how to find the toilets and when we bumped into a cleaning lady and asked the way she turned her nose up at us and said that "she supposed we could change in a vacant room" ( that had not even been cleaned yet!!) she slammed the door behind us and sneared in a military fashion that we had 10 minutes. appauling customer service!!! this was NOT the best way to start my birthday! when we later returned to the hotel we were given directions to our room and once we collected our bags from the "luggage room" discovered that we had to walk a very long way through the hotel and up several flights of dangerously steep stairs with our heavy bags. when we got to the room the only comfort was that the door locked behind us and unlocked when we woke up and left early the next morning. I definately would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “good value for London, clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: Crested_Whippet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Central House Hotel for 4 nights while holidaying in London. Location was good, 10 minute walk to Victoria Tube Station (making it an easy trip from Heathrow). Room was generally small, as expected, but clean and fresh towels daily. WiFi okay for the fee and breakfast included was satisfactory (although the basement breakfast room was awefully hot). Close to good resturants. No worries in recommending this one if your not too fussy.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, cheap, convenient place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: holidayMum_10
Reviews.Content: Set my family's expectations low (ie only want a place to shower and sleep) as we had 5 days in London, and a heap of things to do. Very nervous when told our quad room was in the basement (which I'd read about on Trip Advisor). However, was pleasantly surprised. Room was clean, bathroom clean, sheets and towels clean. Yes, bathroom is small - but who cares at this price, as long as it works and is clean (which it was). There was no light cover on the ceiling lamp, and a wet? pillowcase was left on the top of my suitcase by housekeeping staff one day. However, such small things as these are to be expected at this price. Was very happy with the breakfast - lots of croisants, boiled eggs, cereal and toast, juice, tea and coffee in clean, bright room. It wasn;t a big dining room and sometimes a tight fit, but guests were polite and let one another thru to food serving bar. Staff quickly removed dirty dishes so tables were available for others. All in all, great location close to Pilmico station, happy to have saved $ on hotel and spend it on theatre tickets instead. Only issue was on garbage?/linen? collection morning, as bags must be left outside near our basement window. Woken at 5am and treated to 20 minutes of hearing contractor complaining about his hourly rate etc

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid if you want to have a nice trip!”
Reviews.Author: annais30
Reviews.Content: Firstly location-good,and its the only good thing about this hotel.We got a room with a big boiler next to the room which was making terrible noise,then we swap the room for..basement as nothing else was available.Size of the room terrible and small,shower over the toilet!Shower the size of the shoe box,you can turn or take off your clothes properly.Hotel a bit smelly(probably mould).Saturday 7.10 am came a lady screaming 'room service' and banging on the next door and she woke us up.Breakfast in a cellar,room to small no chair to seat so we had to wait.I slept there 3 night and I mean slept as we tried to avoid coming back earlier.Terrible experience,never again :(

Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: Multitasker04
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and found the hotel convenient, clean and friendly. Our family room was a little tight for space but as we only slept in it it wasn't a problem. The beds were comfortable and clean. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice and the luggage room was a bonus. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Victoria tube and we found the reception staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: s2lockett
Reviews.Content: The hotel representative was not willing to honour the price I was promised through the site I booked this hotel through. Finally after speaking with a Manager the issue was resolved but not easily. The rooms were ok but the shower we had in our room was covered in mold. It was disgusting. The photos of this hotel are very deceiving. The breakfast was not what we were expecting. It was in an old musty basement they've tried to renovate but still very much a cellar. Location was ok. The best part of the hotel was the little convenience store on the corner. They were very friendly and willing to help with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about...but ok...”
Reviews.Author: Finchy88
Reviews.Content: The location is really good, close to the tube and coach station. Staff were friendly and helpful, and will book tickets for anywhere you want to go. We were in room 303, it was ok. Not small as other reviews have mentioned, and bathroom was ok-ish. Nothing amazing. Although, the ensuite wall was constructed half way through the window. Was very stuffy, window wouldn't open fully and as plug socket didn't work the fan was pretty useless. Breakfast wasn't the best...would be nice to have hot breakfasts offered...but was edible, apart from the croissants! Was ok, wouldn't stay there again though. Oh, the rooms on the web site did not look like the room I had!

Reviews.Title: “"at home"”
Reviews.Author: babaManila
Reviews.Content: The location is great!!!! on my first day in the hotel i really dont like the location of my room (its really that on top of the building with no elevator, just only stairs. But then, i requested them to transfer me to another floor/room, and it was granted. Thanks for that! The food, good breakfast. The receptionists, all nice, accommodating, all smiles (but the Pakistani guy before is so shy but he is nice, actually i gave him my knapsack as a souvenir for their kindness to us- we also asked them to checked our online boarding pass going to Rome thru their computer) Nice people. The rooms, no complain. Actually, iam recommending to my friends who are coming to Central london this month, to stay there during their vacation. Regards to u guys......and salamat (thank u) from Philippines >>>> agnes

Reviews.Title: “Good but hot”
Reviews.Author: Mondayo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of June. We were going to Wimbledon to watch the tennis, so wanted somewhere approximately halfway between central London/St Pancras train station and the tennis....which this was. We arrived late on Thursday night, but were greeted warmly and the receptionist/night porter was friendly and gave us some help and tips regarding our stay. We'd specifically picked the hotel for its location and the fact it had a lift and the lift was well sized and working, which was handy as were on the 3rd floor. The only slight negatives we had with the hotel was the size of the en-suite bathroom and the hotness of the room. The bathroom was on the small side, but worked fine for us, but if you like a big shower, this might not be the best shower cubicle for you! I should say we were in room 304, and it was a nice sizeed bedroom which seems to have been relatvively recently painted. Obviously to an extent the heat in the room isn't the fault of the hotel, but maybe leaving the windows open would be a good idea (for the future, if the management are reading this). We opened the windows and then went to a pub round the corner for an hour or so...incidentally there are plenty of bars, shops and restaurants in this area, which was handy and a nice bonus. The room was slightly cooler when we returned, but still very warm and muggy. It cooled a bit during the night, but then the traffic and general everyday noise started about 6am. Not a massive problem, but just something for light sleepers to be aware of. It was a little frustrating to come back on the second night and find the windows closed again and the room very warm. There is a continental breakfast included in the price, but we never tried it. I should also add I have to use a wheelchair to travel longer distances. There are only a few shallow steps upto the front door, which my partner helped me with and then inside the hotel it was all flat, or obviously there was the lift. Overall, we had a good stay and I'd definitely stay there again if I needed to stay in that part of London. Whilst the heat was annoying, I'm sure it's the same for most places at the moment, so I was more making people aware of it, than having a big moan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Friendly staff and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Pottimus
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was great. I was a bit worried when I booked this hotel as the reviews already posted were mixed. When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly, they even upgraded us to a larger room on the 4th floor.The hotel has an elevator which most London hotel don't have. We bought wireless internet minutes for really cheap and the connection was great. The breakfat room in the basement was always well stocked and extremely clean. Croissants,bread for toast,hard boiled eggs, cheese,yogurt,cereal,coffee/hot chocolat/cappucino machine,tea. Over all experience, great. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RobTor
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel, a short walk from Victoria Station. Our room was nice, quiet, clean and had a huge bathroom. All the staff were nice. We enjoyed the "continental" breakfast. It was perfect after a week of "full English" while traveling to Cornwall. The breakfast room is kept clean and well supplied with food. The hotel is good value for money and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skimol
Reviews.Content: The service is terrible. Booked via booking.com; At reception was told that they check reservations from booking.com only one a day.. Also if you book not directly over the phone or their e-mail, the booking (I was told) was only optional... Definetely, I would suggest to pay few pounds more, but be sure about your booking!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory in every way.”
Reviews.Author: mollymum60
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Central House Hotel was satisfactory in every way. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff members were polite and helpful. The location, right near Victoria Station, is convenient and close to many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful stay in London”
Reviews.Author: JaysanAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel which was a very friendly atmosphere. We actually felt like home away from home. All the staffs was very friendly and went above and beyond on a consistent basis with a pleasant smile. I would recommend this hotel to any one and we would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN, WHAT A DUMP!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetie04
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me a theatre trip to London as my christmas present. How do you think he felt when we arrived at this dump. He was very upset. All I can say is that they must have had a good photographer to make the place look like it did on the internet. They shoved us in a room in the basement which was absolutely filthy. We couldnt move and the so called wardrobe had no sides on it and the beading was flapping all over the place. The net curtains where black and the bathroom was filthy with just a "hole" in the floor where there should have been a proper shower. Because of my distress, my husband demanded that we be moved to a different room. The second room was bigger and marginally cleaner. The corridors were shabby and smelled of damp and urine and the so called continental breakfast was just cereal and toast which you had to make yourself if you could get near because it was that small. Absolutely disgusting. The staff were ignorant and when I pointed out that it was one of the worst hotels I had ever stayed in, the man behind reception just said "Thank you. A party of ladies who were equally upset and disgusted had actually found a pair of dirty knickers with a sanitary towel stuck to it. My advise is to avoid this place like the plague. BLOODY AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect when youÂ´re going to visit London not only stay in hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: LaR0se
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks quite good for short staying in London. ItÂ´s not for businessmen, who want to relax after work, but itÂ´s perfect for travellers, who want to get to know London. The corridors are really narrow so you can have some troubles with bigger luggage and the walls are really thin. But I could say the equipment of the room was quite good. Eletric-kettle, spoons, teacups of course tea and sugar. There was TV, ventilator and hairdryer. ThatÂ´s right that the bathroom is really tiny (1m x 1m I guess) so you have to pay attention not to splash outside of the showerbath. But there was a shower gel and a shampoo. Continental breakfast was good. There was everything but i missed some ham (some piece of meat). In general I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Cosy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TraveldWorld23
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to London, I read the reviews in this site, and was worried at what I might find when I arrived at the hotel. But when I did, it was a nice surprise. Reception was friendly and helpful. Our room was at the top floor. True, we had to go up and down narrow staircases, but the room was fine, just like the photos in the site. It wasn't the cleanest of places, but it wasnt bad. Bathroom was clean and water was quite warm. Breakfast was great, especially for the price we had paid. There were eggs,croissants,fruits,toasts,hot beverages, cereal, muffins...anyway, there was also internet access. The hotel's location is excellent, the area of Pimlico is a safe, nice area, and very close to Victoria station, and restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: charlotteandcarl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Central House Hotel for 1 night in Jan as part of a city/theatre break package. Admittedly the hotel was cheap and you get what you pay for but I have never been so underwhelmed in all my life The 1st room we were offered (3) in the basement was so cramped and small it was unbelievable. It had a really musty smell due to being in the basement and I was surprised that when I opened the curtains to let some light in, I was looking down the corridor!!! We promptly refused to stay in it and were offered another room. The 2nd room (14) was somewhat better although I wasnt overly impressed by the 'air conditioning' - A desk fan had been screwed (badly) to the wall. Hilarious! The corridors were dirty, I fell over the carpet fitters tools that he had left strewn all over the place and the breakfast was such a chaotic farce that we avoided it, checked out and ran down the road to a nearby cafe. Next time, I'll pay the extra and avoid this dump like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: ilovesun25
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for two nights at this hotel it was fantastic value great location no. 24 bus stop right outside. Our room was just like pics on the internet (room 12) breakfast good and staff exellent! We will def stay here again on our next visit to London! Its only a 10 min walk to Victoria coach station and 5 mins to Pimlico tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel & Good staff”
Reviews.Author: Marchris82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for this new year weekend and enjoyed the stay with my girl friend. Was just located few minutes away from the victoria station and the staff where very helpful. I really appreciate their assistance with the service they provided, its good that the hotel in open 24 hours we managed to get in to the hotel around 3 midnight. Breakfast was good and liked my entire stay, will love to stay next time and been rewarded a special discount for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “never ever go there again”
Reviews.Author: willy92
Reviews.Content: never was in such a terrible hotel. rooms are so small you can hardly dress your self. Shower was not running true, water was flowing all over the place. TRhe breakfast was awfull. never had such bad coffee. Lot of guest were complaining about toilets not flushing heating not wortking DONT GO THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches in the bathroom! Steer clear of the Central House Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Itsonlymark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace and should be avoided at all costs. I stayed there for 1 night (10th-11th Nov 2009) and I would never EVER go back, nor would I wish such an unpleasant stay on anyone. PLEASE BE AWARE that this hotel is NOT what its website advertises as the pictures bear little resemblance to the actual room. A few details about my Central House Hotel Experience: -Room smelt of stale smoke -Ripped duvet cover -Shabby appearance (dirty walls, holes in the wall, very dirty and scratched laminate floor) -Broken sink -Broken lights -2 Cockroaches in the bathroom (absolutely disgusting and unacceptable!) -Dirty bed-side table (cup stains) -Cracked bathroom tiles -NO HEATING! When I requested to complain about my stay I was told that I was to send an email to the hotel. I have never stayed in such a poor and unsatisfactory hotel. Stay in another neighbouring better quality hotel if you can - there are many in the Victoria area.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE PLACE! Don't waste your money on this dump!”
Reviews.Author: AndiRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here (room 303) for two nights on the end of our London/Berkshire vacation. We were trying to find a reasonably priced place to stay in the same area where friends were also staying (Winchester Hotel). This was our only option and we were quite disappointed! The room was tiny and definitely needed to be renovated. The walls and ceilings were cracked. The paint was peeling off the walls. The bathroom was full of mold and mildew. The tiles were cracked and loose. The shower curtain had blood stains and mildew on the bottom of it. The trash hadn't been emptied and there was a used female hygiene pad behind the toilet wrapped in tissue that somehow got overlooked. The cherry on top was the pubic hair that was located in the bed when I pulled the sheets down to go to bed. I complained but nothing was done. I told the guy at the desk that Trip Advisor would be getting "a page-full about this dump." I know it was an inexpensive place to stay, but at least clean the place!!! It is rated three stars, I wouldn't give it one. I'd rather stay in a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “If there is a worst hotel in London I've yet to see it”
Reviews.Author: redcoat_uk
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room for myself and it was far smaller than any single room I've ever stayed in before. The bathroom facilties are even smaller, bearly room for one person not wholly clean and strange smelling. The worst day of my stay was day 3 - the day started out with no hot water (whole hotel), I then returned home at the end of the day to find my mobile phone had been stolen from my room! Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “the ceiling leaked!”
Reviews.Author: bowchickawowow
Reviews.Content: We were initially happy & felt it offered value for money, but during the night the ceiling started to leak through the light & smoke detector. We reported it straight away but they could not offer another room, only a bucket. Luckily it missed the bed but it disturbed our night because I was feeling anxious. In the morning we were stepping around a soggy carpet & worried about being electrocuted. I also suspect the smoke detector was not working & that stains around the fittings meant this was not a new problem. On checking out we asked for a refund but it was not forthcoming. The desk staff maintained he was not able to make a decision on a refund & he was unable to contact the manager. No concern was offered & we were advised to write a complaint & leave it with them. The next day my husband spoke to the manager & was finally offered 50% refund. Although this went some way to compensate us we do not feel this was adequate & a full refund should have been given out of goodwill.

Reviews.Title: “Think compact and you'll not go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: JuJu61
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews on Trip Advisor saying that the hotel rooms here were on the small side and that was definitely the case (we were in Room 108). We could not open our cases up fully on the floor and had to put them onto the bed each time we needed to access them. We couldnâ€™t empty our cases to eliminate the need to do this and put things into the wardrobe as this was so small that it would not have held more than six items in it â€“ we were staying for five days so were not light on clothes. There were no drawers in the room and the wardrobe did not have a door on it. There was a safe in the room that we could use, but it did take up valuable room in the wardrobe. There was a little balcony outside our window, but there was a notice on the window asking tenants not to go on to the balcony, presumably because it was not safe, but this didn't matter anyway as we couldn't open the door fully to access the balcony because the bed was right at the side of it. Whilst the room was very much on the small side, it was very clean and tidy and was serviced every day by the cleaners. Other reviewers had said that the staff here were unfriendly and ignorant - I would like to say that in our experience the staff here were totally the opposite. They greeted you each time and were most helpful when asked for help and advice. They provide a number of leaflets in the reception area for things to do whilst in London and will book you onto a tour with the company in the leaflets if required. Breakfast served here is continental (wish London hoteliers would go back to Full English), and plentiful. It is self service, but the staff are on hand to fill trays back up, and we were never hanging around waiting for supplies to be replenished. All in all, this is a good London hotel, ideally placed between Victoria and Pimlico tube stations. Yes, its rooms are small, but after all you are only borrowing the room for a little while, not setting up residence there. We would definitely consider booking here for a short stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pay For A Prison Cell !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WORLDWIDE111
Reviews.Content: Let me start from the begining. From Victoria TRain Station was a good 10-15 minutes walk with luggages and on the way I saw many other hotels, passsed some grtocery store , restaruant and KFc. The outside of the hotel is nice in order to attract custmers to a prison. Anyway got in it was warm and the reception guy was okay. Booked family room expecting a room like on their website but no!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! "Here you go room 52 in the basement" said the staff After opening many fire door and many turns (like a maze) i found it asnd expecting a nice room but no. okay the key rarely fits as its old fashioned and some room keys werte attcually cards and the room using cards to open were attcually cheaper or the same price as this room! Okay got in super small with little amennty like a prison. Family room is one samll sofa bed smaller than doubke bed and one real double bed. The floor wasnt carpet it was atucally fake wood that squeeks when ever you go on it. The TV wsas on the roof and small and not walking. There were water pipes and a stinky smell as sewage go on top of the room. okay bathroom small and poorly mainted and shampoo was running low. THere was a small desk with a chair and the desrk was filled weith junks like instant cofee with dirty mugs and feedback forms. THe gunranteed wifi signal in my room was not avalible. Okay later on i go and complain and this indian staff with a bad atictiude hears our consverstion "May I help you" "Yes I want to know complasin about the room 52 and thw wifi signal" "I understand room 52 is poor and all the other basement rooms so I change your room" regarding wifi signal who said it was avialbe in your room" "Your website and your collegue" "Okay you may be right but i need to see your proof" anyway after arguing they agreed to switch room the next day to a diffrent family room. The breakfast = horrible. not wholly cooked egg , toast,yougurt,milk,creal,juice,butter, packaked muffin,cofee. Okay so I can bear with it When i got my room changed i found out it was much better and was atucally the same rate as room 52. I had room 17 on the ground floor with wifi signal. SO I unlock the door with a CARD then the floor was carpet and this time real beds not it looks a bit like the websites picture. The toilet shower however was a flaw it was about 2cm lower than the toiolet floor with just a curtain blocking so it floods easliy. Nextg day I deciede to complain for a compesation about my first night and there I was with the bad attitude indian manager. When I told her everything she said "What do you expect this isnt 5 star its only a budget hotel" after listing out the things she relieved her dtress on me she said "I have other things to worry about too like my daughters school .. any other things please tell me in writing" The story is way to long on all the bad things remeber JUST DONT BOOK THIS HOTEL THE BASEMENT ROOMNS ARE LIKE A PRISON!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If you cant give up the location or the price there are hotels very clse to it including nextdoor Let me tell you some next doors like Easyhotel, AScot Hotel,and many more go on google maps street view and look for your self for the hotel names. The computer in the lobby cost money

Reviews.Title: “booked and turned up and was told we didn't have a room!”
Reviews.Author: Huggles_83
Reviews.Content: We booked our room 3 months in advance. After travelling from Australia (a good 24 hours) we turned up to the hotel for them to tell us that they did not have a room for us. They tried to tell us that it had a leek and we could not stay, even though on the top of the regestration card it said "dummy room" as in, they probably overbooked and had to find us alternative accomodation for 1 night then move us back to their hotel for the 2nd night So we then had to walk another 10 minutes with luggage to get to the best western which was actually better than this hotel. On the 2nd night we stayed here we were appauled, the room was about as big as a closet. hard to fit 2 people and luggage in it! and the bathroom was like a port-a-loo! I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like the pics on the website”
Reviews.Author: lisa_638
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd looked at the other reviews before I booked this hotel. I did check out the hotel's website though before booking and the room looked very different to the ones on the website when we arrived at the hotel. It was tiny, a double bed and a 'wardrobe' which was tiny and fitted about 5 things in it. The bed was unstable and the bedside lights didn't work, we had 2 sockets in the room, of which 1 didn't work. The bathroom was the size of a cupboard and you had to shut the door to get into the shower. The shower was a corner of the bathroom- no cubicle, and the side was maybe 2 inches deep, so after 2 mins the whole bathroom floor was flooded. We were put in a room in the basement area, and the corridors off the kitchen and dining room were grubby and smelled bad. When we came back to the room one night the maid had opened the window and we were on the ground floor. It seemed more like a 2 star hotel than a 3 star to me. Apart from that the hotel was fine.... lol.

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: riveravon
Reviews.Content: if you are planning a cheap weekend in london this is the place to stay clean ,freindly, warm. very good breakfast and lots of it .and good local pub just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: bennachie
Reviews.Content: Inspite of the the views of some others I have to say that some of the rooms do look like those on the web site and we were lucky enough to have one. Although small, it was clean and smart and being at the back quiet. One the one cold night of our stay the radiator came on and the room was warm. The shower room was small, as you might expect when it was created out of the bedroom, but fit for purpose. The breakfast was continental but there seemed to be plenty. However I longed to rearrange the serving area as a less convenient arrangement would be difficult to imagine. This is not a luxury hotel but for a few days of sightseeing and shows it is quite adequate and conveniently situated for both Victoria and Pimlico statins and only 30minutes walk from Big Ben.

Reviews.Title: “For Cold sleepless nights, this is a must!”
Reviews.Author: DekeIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and Close to Victoria which were the only two good points. The room looked nothing like theWebsite, with shoebox Bathroom/shower. Windows were single glazed and must have been the original installed. They were unlockable and draughty. Our room was in the basement and was where the bags of Laundry were delivered over the railings at 7am each morning. Breakfast was chaos. Interestingly, 6 unfortunate guests were stuck in the lift and the staff were oblivious until we told them[even with an alarm going off] Would not like to repeat this experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Richard9691
Reviews.Content: If it werent for the fact we were only here 1 night and we had paid in advance we would undoubtedly have checked out again. The room was filthy and the shower room almost unuseable. I have stayed in typical London B&B's before but after this one I felt like I needed fumigating. It was minging and I barely slept thinking about the state of the place. I am still itching now. (4 days later) It was alike to a youth hostel not a hotel. Breakfast was ok but when they ran out of crossants and we asked for more it was met with a dissaproving grunt. stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Really Comfortable Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineCocktails
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Valentines day. Really comfortable beds, had a brilliant sleep! As for the breakfast, didn't try this because we opted for lay-in(!) but the room seemed lovely and clean. It does face a main road, but this didn't really affect us, you couldn't really hear the roads. The room is VERY small, with a tiny wadrobe and bathroom (more like a wet room) but if you're not here longer than about 3 nights then you will be ok!

Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay here if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: SunnyB2
Reviews.Content: Before I went on a short getaway I read some of the reviews which weren't too good but the pics on the hotel's own website looked fine plus the price for a Lodon central location was also good. The hotel is in a nice central area and the reception area was very clean, contemporary and all the staff were very friendly throughout the stay. The double room we booked was very small but clean and refurbished and we only wanted to spend the night there anyway. The breakfast in the morning was really nice and we could eat as much as we liked, so if you are in London and on a budget and are not planning on spending a lot of time in the room, it's worth giving this hotel a go, we paid less then Â£50 for B&B, there are a couple of tube stations nearby as well as all the shops, pubs and restaurant one would need.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: Carol012
Reviews.Content: Grate location, close to Victoria and Pimlico Stations. Bus 24 which took us to central part of London. A staff in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We were very happy with breakfast and room. I can truly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: N0rthernLa55
Reviews.Content: Where to begin... the reception is literally held together with ducktape. And be warned, the rooms look nothing like the samples on the website. The beds are so soft they're more like a camping bed. The "ensuite" is a cupboard you step up into which then floods when you have a shower. There is only single glazing, so you can hear everything going on outside. I finally got to sleep at 4am!!! I would have had breakfast but all I could smell was burning so decided against it. I couldn't wait to check out!! 1 night was more than enough. I would never, ever, recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never repeat this mistake of staying at Central House Hotel when visiting London”
Reviews.Author: sharonanna
Reviews.Content: On arrival in our room late in the evening (No 56) we found that the central heating was not working there was one electric heater supplied by the hotel in the room. The hallway was a lot warmer than our room. After complaining another electric heater was bought to our room which did not make much difference. We asked to be moved to another room but was told there was non available and the hotel was fully booked. After ten minutes the main light had water leaking through it which resulted in water dripping on one of the beds. We decided that we could not stay in the room and we wanted to be moved, after taking our belongings to reception and much ado we were finally moved to another room. Which ultimately was not a lot better but was warm and there was no leaking lights. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone I know and certainly will not make this mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: eneate
Reviews.Content: I freaked out a little when I read the other reviews about this hotel because I had already booked it and had no chance to find another one. I must say that I had a pleasant surprise when I saw the hotel. The reception smelled of paint but everything else was OK. The woman who attended us spoke to us in a perfect Spanish to make sure we understood her. There was a lift that seemed new. We had a room in the basement (room 4), next to the room were breakfast was served. Although there was noise during the breakfast hours, it wasnâ€™t excessive. The room looked like the ones on the website. It was extremely hot inside (too much heating) and we had a window that faced the street which at first we thought it may be insecure. It wasnâ€™t at all because Belgrave Road is a safe place. The cleaning was OK, except in the bathroom where the cleaning left a lot to be desired. The bathroom was extremely little. The shower pan was at the level of the floor and the shower head was fixed, so when someone had a shower the bathroom flooded. The breakfast was OK. There wasnâ€™t much variety but there was enough for everyone. The hotel was close to several bus stops, the stations of Pimlico (the closest one) and Victoria and it wasnâ€™t too far away from Buckingham Palace. Overall I liked it a lot but itâ€™s true itâ€™s too expensive for itâ€™s value.

Reviews.Title: “The only advantage is the location.”
Reviews.Author: Goroz
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, rooms even in the basement be carefull before you go there.The bathroom was very small, like a bathroom of a ship. No lobby at all because of renovation. No internet access for the customers in the building. It was the worst hotel I've ever been. How did they got three stars??? The only good thing was the staff of the hotel which was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Room 52. The Gateway to Hell.”
Reviews.Author: dontbotherunpacking
Reviews.Content: OK so I know what you're thinking - it's London prices. It's a budget hotel. So it's never going to be the Ritz, is it? But I'm fairly sure even the waste disposal area at the Ritz is going to be a step up compared to this. I thought I'd list the hotel's 'features' and you can decide for yourself whether to book yourself in or perhaps look elsewhere. Reception area - Has obviously been wittily refitted in a retro 1970's style (surely?) Bus station meets youth hostel. Service was swift but I suspect mainly to keep people moving and not give anyone the chance to complain anymore than they were already. Corridor areas - In a sheer stroke of luck Room 52 is in the basement allowing a fully exploration of the hotel's corridor system. It turns out those carpets weren't actually patterned. It was stains. And handles on doors are so last year. I can fully see their point. And what's this? An outside corridor? How exciting. It's raining but in a corridor? Look on the bright side though you'd be perfectly safe in a fire. Something this damp is never going to burn. The Room - Obviously the card swipe system wasn't working. And obviously all hotels need a healthy gap between the door and the floor allowing clear conversations between you and any other lucky guests who are walking by. What's this? A laminate floor? A patterned laminate flo .... Oh no ... My mistake more stains. Thrill at the creaks as the floor shifts as you move across it. Be amazed at how anyone could fit a floor this badly. Watch out for the rotten bit by the radiator. Again - on the more positive side - no one is going to creep up on you in the middle of the night. The bed is comfy and clean - which is just as well as it's just about the only part of the hotel that is. The furniture has seen better days and there's an odd bit just above the bed with a badly nailed on (it fell off) hardboard cover. A little later on that evening it became clear what that was ... Anyway onto the bathroom which possibly is the only one I've been in where you have a serious risk of being dirtier coming out than when you went in. Rot on the door frame, mould on the walls. But the shower .... It was amazing. Rather than risk giving the staff something extra to clean the hotel has decided just to use a shower tray. Someone perhaps needs to point out that it's quite hard to keep water in the shower tray using fresh air alone. Mind you, to be fair, there was a lot of hot water. Sadly mainly on the floor. So back to the bedroom and the mysterious box above the bed. Turns out it's the soil pipe from the room above. Some people prefer the sounds of whales singing, some people count sheep and others think of little fluffy rabbits as they drift off to sleep. And me? How many pints had they drunk in order to have a wee that long? Sleep tight.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Wendy_James
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Superbreak. I can assure you there was nothing super about it and it wasn't the setting for the romantic break I'd envisaged. It was Â£94 for one double room with continental breakfast. Despite requesting a room on an upper floor when we booked, we were assigned to room 52 which was in the basement - accessed by a dirty corridor and several sets of stairs. There was a window on one side - through which you could see and hear people walking past on the street. The blind was wonky and didn't fit all the way across the window. The floor was laminated wood effect, with dirty marks all over and creaked where ever you trod. The room was at the beginning of the corridor to the other rooms in the basement area so there was a lot of noise and shutting of doors from people going to their rooms beyond ours. The room was cold - the radiator didn't work but there was a plug in electric heater. The bathroom was tiny and frankly the worst I have ever seen (and I've stayed in some skanky places) - there was mould, flaking paint, rust, a cracked basin, dirty taps. There was no bath, but a shower tray that was so shallow you could only have a quick shower or else the tray would have overflowed as the water didn't drain away very quickly. On the plus side I have to say the shower was powerful and there was plenty of hot water. There was a tiny tv on a wall bracket - binoculars would have been helpful - and a small 'wardrobe' without sides - so basically just a front and a back and a rail with one coat hanger. We did complain twice (immediately once we saw the room and again before we went out for dinner) but were told there were no other rooms available. The man on reception said he'd speak to the manager later (apparently he wasn't there at that time) and get back to us but never did (and we stayed out as late as we could). We took some photos of the most offending bits of the room on our mobile phone and showed them to him - he said he was sorry but reiterated there was no other room to give us and they were very busy , there had been a mix-up with some rooms earlier and it was his first day back off holiday and he couldn't do anything about it. The worst part of the whole experience was the 'box on the wall above the bed' that we discovered later, after getting into bed (and the bed itself was actually very comfortable), turned out to house the waste pipe from a room above. I won't go into detail but suffice to say we went to bed and were greeted in the morning by sounds that no-one should have to endure. They may as well have been going to the toilet at the end of our bed. I am not overly fussed by many things but I had to put the pillow over my head to stop myself gagging. We didn't hang around to sample the continental breakfast so I can't comment on that. Needless to say we're taking this up with Superbreak.

Reviews.Title: “Satan's favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: notthecentralhouse
Reviews.Content: Where shall I start, well I booked this hotel through Expedia and paid well over what the horrible dive was worth. I arrived at reception and like all crap hotels they had made mistakes with my booking. After 5 minutes of tinkering with the computer and sifting what looked like a collection of papers marked with coffee rings they found me a room. Room 55, it may as well of being in another part of London. This room is located in another part of the hotel and is accessible by going into the basement and then coming up about 4 flights of stairs at the other side, all broken up by ridiculously narrow doorways. The walk to the room was grim, disgusting hallways, the carpets didn't match any of the way, not just different patterns but completely different colours and not particularly well laid. The room itself was still in the care of the cleaners when I arrived. I think they were having some kind of tea party because my bathroom certainly wasn't clean. The wooden floor in the room looked like something you would find in student housing. The blinds on the windows were scummy to say the least, my partner had to climb on the bed and roll them down from the roof because the cords were broken. The TV was a portable thing on a bracket in the corner and the wardrobe was 4 pieces of wood screwed together, a rail running across and no doors. There was no number to telephone reception, probably to avoid the compaint calls. The only saving grace was the bed which was comfortable. The bathroom was the worst I've ever seen and I've seen some real[-]. The floor wasn't tiled and if you took 1 step forward from the toilet you would be in the shower basin. I have seen better bathrooms on camp sites. Would I stay here again? Maybe if I was homeless, pennyless, saturated from 40 days and 40 nights of relentless rain and it was free. Until then not until hell becomes incredibly cold. Anyone planning on booking this hotel I would advise you to really think again, unless they're paying you to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in London; Easy Location”
Reviews.Author: Hamik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week during our vacation to London. Our goal was to find a reasonably priced hotel in a good location, and this fit the bill. Upon check-in, we were assigned to an impossibly small room on the second floor - the bathroom was practically 3'x3', and there wasn't really even room to walk around the bed. I noticed that there wasn't a room safe, so I went down to the desk to ask. While I was there, I asked if there were any larger rooms available, and the desk clerk happily moved us to a MUCH larger room on the first floor. That room had a little hallway right inside the door, with a large bathroom, desk and lots of room. Much better! The breakfast room is a little chaotic, as the area where the food is located is cramped. And, they need to buy another toaster or two. There was a line every morning! Staff was friendly and accommodating. Location-wise, it's an easy walk or bus ride to Victoria Station, and there are several restaurants nearby. Overall good value for the money - just ask for a larger room when you check in!

Reviews.Title: “What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Gateford_Family
Reviews.Content: Absolutely what I expected! Needed to be in Westminster on business, and wanted something nearby, cheap, and clean. I got something very near Westminster, cheap, and overall pretty clean. Gripes? Not really, I paid under Â£100, and thats what I got. Bathroom cubicle is amazingly small, but works. Was on the first floor, and the traffic noise was a bit of a problem. Would I stay again? Yes, if it was a fleeting visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, overall quite satisfied with it”
Reviews.Author: tsque
Reviews.Content: We read about horrible stories on cheap hotels and mananged to find the middle-price range Central House. Overall we were happy with the hotel. The rooms were small but ok. The shower, however, is really small and the water spilled over to the toilet bowl and the floor got really wet which was annoying. The location, although is about 10 mins from Victoral Station, is rather hard to find on our first day as the address of other buildings on the same side of the road are rather "messy". We nearly thought we walked the wrong way. After the first day, we had no problems going to-and-fro the station. The plus points are, they provide kettle for boiling water, which we were told are not provided in most Europe hotels. The breakfast, though simple, is good enough for budget travellers like us. I would recommand this hotel for travellers who want a simple and yet affordable hotel. The location, which is near to the Victoral Station is already a major plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confotable”
Reviews.Author: tomasg
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights. Everything was clean and working well. The hotel stuff was friendly and helpfull they even offer me to print out an easyjet boaring card (free of charge). They had an Ice mashine in the reception. The single room I had was in the basement. It was small but confortable. The bathroom was big enought and had a badtub what is great after a whole day of walking (to relax and sleep well). I had a none smoking room. My room had a smoke detector. Please donÂ´t try to smoke inside non smoking rooms, one morning a guy started smoking inside of the room and he triggered the fire alarm waiking up everybody. If I have to go to London again I will try to stay in Central House.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: CJB77
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in this hotel for my parents' Ruby Wedding anniversary in February 2008. When we first arrived it was before check-in and we just wanted to leave our luggage. The receptionist simply gave me the key to the luggage room and sent me to the basement without even checking who I was. The location of the hotel is good (between Victoria and Pimlico stations) and the price was reasonable for London - we paid Â£72 a night for â€œdouble roomsâ€�. However...... - Size of the room: the room my boyfriend and I were given could not be called a double. There was hardly any room around the bed and we had to take it in turns to unpack and get changed. See the attached photo and youâ€™ll see how little room there was around the bed, and I took the photo with my back to the wall. I did mention to a member of staff that really we were paying double room rates for what could only be describe as a single, and she just smiled at me and walked away. My parents and my brother and sister in law had better sized rooms, however all of them had the smallest bathrooms I've ever seen. As my Dad said, the bathrooms are bigger on North Sea Ferries..... - Cleanliness: the room wasn't all that clean; the shower curtain and bathroom door were dirty, and there were big cobwebs on the ceiling. I don't think the carpet was very well hoovered either, but in all fairness to the cleaners they probably couldn't fit the hoover in the room anyway. - Electrics: looked a bit dodgy - Service: I asked the hotel to chill a bottle of champagne for me to celebrate my parents' anniversary and they were unable to help. We also asked to borrow an iron only to be told the only one they had had been borrowed and they couldn't remember by who so were unable to get it back for us. Having said that, we would probably have had to do the ironing in the corridor as a board wouldn't have fit in our room (seriously). Breakfast: this was ok and there was plenty of it, just not the freshest food or the best quality (tinned fruit, croissants were a bit chewy). The kitchen area was tiny and people were falling over each other to get to the fridge or get cups of coffee. Other: there we no hooks anywhere in our room, so nowhere to hang our coats, and no hooks or towel rails to hang up our wet towels. Also, the safe in the room was Â£2 a day - I've never had to pay for a hotel safe before. So all in all we were unimpressed. I know you can't expect a 5* hotel for that money in London, but I still feel the service and cleanliness could have been better, plus a few additions to the rooms (a towel rail, for example) could make a real difference. Plus I still feel we were ripped off by them calling our room a double.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for us but glad I want there for two weeks.”
Reviews.Author: mrbilbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and went to see Wicked (me, the wife & eight year old daughter). The hotel is fantastically situated for the Theatre, Victoria Station and the bus. In fact there is bus stop right outside the door, and unlike previous London visits we used the bus the most this time. The hotel is also near a range a nice restaurants and shops (the mexican was rather good and welcoming). So no faults with the location at all. The hotel is basic and budget and definately no frills but hey thats what we paid for and lets be honest we were out of the hotel at 9.30am each day returning at 11pm.
